message.content:
{"id": "7734", "title": "Bug 7734: System can be shut down without save file warnings", "description": "", "OB": "When a WSWB session is open with some opened, dirty .txt file, shutting down Windows will cause the loss of the changes in the .txt file.", "EB": "", "SR": "To reproduce: 
1. Start WSWB and create a new project.
2. Create a text file in the project and add a line of text to it.
3. Notice that the text file is marked as a dirty file.
4. Left click on the Windows Start menu and select the 'Shut Down...' command to shut down/reboot the computer.

Results:
There is no warning or question message box to give users a chance to save their dirty model(s); the computer is shut down/rebooted immediately.

Expected behavior:
When the user attempts to shut down or reboot the computer while a WSWB session is active with unsaved changes in a text file, a warning or question message box should pop up, allowing the user to save their progress before proceeding with the shutdown/reboot process. Other Windows programs (like Word, Outlook, etc.) provide such warnings, and WSWB should do the same to prevent loss of work."}

origin.input_prompt:
Your role is a senior software engineer, you are very good at analyzing and writing bug reports.
It is possible that the bug report may lack sufficient details in the OB, EB, and SR sections.  In such cases, your task is to infer the appropriate details based on the context and supplement the bug report to ensure it contains clear and complete OB/EB/SR statements.  Also, improve the wording of these statements for clarity where possible.
To facilitate this process, please provide your responses in JSON format as follows:
{"id": "", "title": "", "description": "", "OB": "", "EB": "", "SR": ""}
